summary: "Blue Velvet" is a 1986 American movie by David Lynch, mixing horror and film noir. It follows a college student who finds a severed ear and gets entangled in a criminal conspiracy and a romance with a singer. The film was first met with mixed reviews due to its graphic content but is now considered one of Lynch's best works and a top film of the 1980s. It helped revive Dennis Hopper's career and showcased Isabella Rossellini's acting talent.
title: Blue Velvet (film)
